howItWorks.titleLine1: From the strength test to pull-ups,
howItWorks.desc: We break each skill down into technique, common mistakes, and clear progressions for your current level. The strength test shows where you are now, your goal defines what you‚Äôre working toward, and your personalized program plus coach video reviews help you reach it safely and effectively.

steps.title: Define your level and goals
steps.text: You take our strength test: 5‚Äì7 exercises depending on the course you choose and the equipment you have. We lock in your current level and pick the main goal.

steps.title: Build a program for your level
steps.text: Based on your test, we choose the right exercises and progressions, explain proper technique, and go through common mistakes.

steps.title: Train and build a stronger body
steps.text: You follow workouts in the app, mark completed sessions, and send video check-ins to your coach. The coach gives feedback and updates your training as you progress. You‚Äôll see your strength grow, your technique improve, and your goal become achievable.

courses.badge: Online programs for gym and home
courses.title: Goals and programs
courses.desc: Choose the direction that fits you best right now ‚Äî you can switch to another course at any time. The program adapts flexibly to your level and interests.
courses.scrollHint: Swipe right to see all programs.
courses.scrollNote: Any course can be adapted to your starting level.

light.title: Calisthenics Light
light.desc: A gentle way back into training if you haven‚Äôt worked out in a while or spend a lot of time at a computer. No burnout, no ‚Äúkiller‚Äù routines.

super.title: Super Calisthenics
super.desc: The main course if you simply want to get strong: full body work, progress in pull-ups, handstands, and core basics.

pullupsGirls.title: Pull-ups for girls
pullupsGirls.desc: The goal is your first confident pull-up. No stress, no comparisons, and no ‚Äúthis isn‚Äôt for you‚Äù comments.
features: Super Calisthenics with your chosen goal

handstand.title: Handstand
handstand.desc: From ‚Äúnever held a wall handstand‚Äù to confident balance. We build mobility, strength, and body position awareness.

crossfit.title: Calisthenics for CrossFitters
crossfit.desc: If you want to add confident strict movements to your kipping: pull-ups, handstand push-ups, and muscle-ups ‚Äî without sacrificing technique or shoulders.
features: 60‚Äì80 minutes per workout, pull-up bar needed
Scapular and core strength for gymnastics

pricing.title: How much training costs
pricing.desc: You buy a workout block, complete it at your own pace, and then take the next one. No subscription and no auto-charges.
pricing.noteLeft: 1 workout = a personalized plan in the app + technique review based on your videos.
pricing.noteRight: You can use the workouts at your own pace, with no strict deadlines.

slow12.title: 12 workouts ‚Äî easy pace

long36.title: 36 workouts
long36.text: For those who are staying long-term and want steady progress.

about.title: From a studio to a digital system
about.lead: I Do Calisthenics is a calisthenics school that grew from a studio in Moscow into a bodyweight training system for people all over the world. We combine the experience of in-person coaching with the convenience of an app.

story.p1_prefix: We opened our first studio more than
story.p1_suffix: years ago. Since then, we‚Äôve coached thousands of people: breaking down technique step by step, selecting progressions, and finding the right approach for every athlete‚Äîso movement becomes clear and accessible.
story.p2: Now that experience has moved into a digital format. Everything we used to coach hands-on in the gym has become a system: clear steps from basic movements to advanced skills.
story.p3: For us, online isn‚Äôt a compromise‚Äîit‚Äôs a continuation of what works. You can train from anywhere in the world: at home, on a bar in your yard, or in the gym.
story.mission: Our mission is to help people become stronger, freer, and more confident.

gallery.desc: Calisthenics brings together people of different ages and levels‚Äîthose who want to get stronger or learn skills they‚Äôve been dreaming about for a long time.

testimonials.title: What students say
testimonials.desc: Below are a few reviews from people who have already taken the strength test, received a technique review, and are training with our system.

list.name: Katya (kat.garina)
list.text: I followed the account for a long time and hesitated: would online training actually bring progress, and how would I combine it with regular strength workouts at the gym. Two months ago I decided to try ‚Äî and it turned out to be the best decision. I started calisthenics from zero, and two months is of course not enough to talk about incredible progress, but even now I can see that I feel and control my body better, and because of that my strength numbers in the gym improved too. I like that the exercises are varied and there‚Äôs always a small step forward. Special thanks to Dasha for clear technique explanations, support, and patient answers to my million questions ü´∂üèª I dream of visiting an offline session the next time I travel to Russia!

list.name: Zhenya (mequinte)
list.text: I‚Äôve always been into sports, but lately I had limited time and got bored of doing standard exercises/programs. For a year now I‚Äôve been training calisthenics with you and it exceeded all my expectations! My strength has increased a lot, and at the same time I became more flexible, solid, and enduring. My body settled into a nice shape, even though I didn‚Äôt lose much weight (because I refuse to go on a strict diet). Coach Dasha often sends extra videos to explain unclear details. We set shared goals and work towards them. And of course, what‚Äôs very important to me ‚Äî I can train when it‚Äôs convenient for ME. Love you! Wishing you many years of success! ‚ù§Ô∏è

list.name: Inna (easy_inna_)
list.text: Hello! I‚Äôve been training for the third month ‚Äî since January. I decided to try and unexpectedly found the perfect format for myself: I train when it‚Äôs convenient, and the need to send reports keeps me disciplined) Every workout has different exercises ‚Äî it‚Äôs really interesting. At first it was quite easy, now they adjusted the load and many exercises are already challenging, which is exciting) And there is progress, of course ‚Äî it‚Äôs a great feeling when you get stronger and an exercise becomes easier! My goal is to learn pull-ups with my own bodyweight by summer, and I feel like I‚Äôm already confidently halfway there)

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.desc: If you still have doubts, there‚Äôs probably an answer here. If not, you can always ask the coach a question before you start.

items.question: Is this suitable if I‚Äôve never trained before?
items.answer: Yes. We start with a strength test and simple exercises to understand your level. The program scales to you: from the most basic movements to skills. No ‚Äúcompare to norms‚Äù ‚Äî we only compare you today with you in a few weeks.

items.question: How long does one workout take?
items.answer: On average 30‚Äì60 minutes depending on the format and your level. For beginner programs it‚Äôs closer to 30‚Äì40 minutes. You can train at home, outdoors, or in a gym‚Äîwhatever feels more comfortable.

items.question: Do I need a pull-up bar or a gym?
items.answer: At the very beginning you can train without a gym: some programs are designed for home workouts. But to progress in pull-ups and skills, a pull-up bar or access to a playground is still needed. We‚Äôll tell you the minimal setup worth starting with.

items.question: How does the coach give feedback on technique?
items.answer: You record one set on video and upload it to the app. The coach watches, points out mistakes, gives comments and corrections. Based on that, they build your next workout or adjust the current block so you progress safely.

items.question: What if I miss workouts or fall out of schedule?
items.answer: That‚Äôs normal‚Äîlife doesn‚Äôt always fit a perfect plan. If you miss something, you just return to the program where you left off. The coach can adapt the plan to your new reality: reduce volume, change frequency, or rebuild the week.

items.question: Can I change the course or goal during a training block?
items.answer: Yes. You buy a training block, not a rigid commitment to one course. If during the process you want to shift focus‚Äîfor example from pull-ups to a handstand‚Äîdiscuss it with the coach and they‚Äôll adapt the program.

faq.cta: Still unsure where to start? Try the free strength test ‚Äî it‚Äôs a safe way to understand your level and the training format.
